Yes, the [Hector IMU Gazebo plugin](http://wiki.ros.org/hector_gazebo_plugins) \(used in VRX\)  follows the ROS convention \(see[ REP 103](https://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0103.html)\) for the body frame to be reported in ENU.  It is very common to have a sensor that works in NED and have to adapt higher level code to deal cleanly with the conventions.  

It is difficult to recommend solutions specific to your setup without understanding more about your setup.  Could you add images of your tf tree and ROS graph?  That might help folks give you advice.
